string.value: Talking to Stan

string.name: parent
string.value: Alex the Runaway Kid

At the entrance of Henesys Park, you meet Alex's father, Stan, the chief of Henesys. You couldn't even start up a conversation with him. He wants you to get him #b30 Evil Eye's tails and 60 pig ribbons#k before he'll even talk to you.

#t4000007# #b#c4000007##k/30
#t4000002# #b#c4000002##k/60
You talked with Alex's father, Stan, and settled the father-son misunderstandings. You got Alex's mother's gold watch in return.

You want to talk to me? I'm the chief of this town, and I have no time for a conversation. If you really want to talk to me, then collect these materials for the town. #b#e30#n #t4000007#s#k and #b#e60#n #b#t4000002#s#k. Then we'll talk.

Who are you? I don't think we've met.
#b#L0# I'm just a traveler.
Don't mind me.#l
#L1# I'm here on #p1052000#'s behalf.
Just give me five minutes.#l
#L2# Haha...isn't it beautiful today?#l

#p1052000#? Ha, I no longer have a son with that name. Get out of here!
#b#L0# Ah... Yes, sir. Sorry for bothering you.#l
#L1# But #p1052000# wants to come home.#l
#L2# Cut it out! #p1052000# is sorry for running away!#l

Eh? Confronting me now? Yelling at me in public? Hmm, you must be somebody important. Fine. How's #p1052000# doing?
#b#L0# #p1052000# is having a hard time since he ran away.#l
#L1# #p1052000# is getting sick of wandering around.#l
#L2# Why don't you ask #p1052000# yourself?#l

Ask him myself? Hahahaha! I like you. That makes me wonder. What do YOU think of ME?
#b#L0# I think you are a great chief.#l
#b#L1# I think you are too harsh on Alex.#l
#b#L3# I think you hide the fact that you're actually a person of warmth.#l

Yes, like you said, I'm the chief, but ever since #p1052000# left, I've been losing face!
#b#L0# #p1052000# knows he made poor decisions, but now he's asking for forgiveness. What he needs right now is a compassionate father.#l
#b#L1# Are you worried less about your son and more about your image in this town? You've got to be kidding me!#l
#b#L2# #p1052000#'s been unsettled since his mother past away. Your strict nature hasn't helped him any. How about forgiving him?#l

You know THAT much? I suppose it's true that #p1052000# has been more rebellious since Anna passed away. I've been busy with my chiefly duties, and perhaps I've neglected him. Perhaps this is my fault...
What do you think I am, a tourist attraction? Shame on you...and get out of my face.
Ah yes, such a beautifuly day...or not! I have no time for idle chit chat. Scram!
What a chicken.You tell me you know #p1052000# and then want to flee when I get angry? I don't even want to speak to you. Get out of here.
He wants to come home? Hahaha...! That's a lie! I'm sure he's happy that he can do whatever he wants now, especially since he took my money, too.
He's having a hard time? Good! Please give him this message: #bStay away. Feel the pain. Experience the hard life! Then maybe you'll learn a thing or two about being independent.
Sick of it?! He wants to come home now that he's sick of living alone? Hahahahahahha! As of this moment, I know no #p1052000#! What an ungrateful... Argh.
You are brutally honest. I usually like honesty, but I don't appreciate your candor one bit right now. Are you trying to make me mad?
Hahaha! You're either very observant or you're a kiss-up. Either way, it doesn't matter. I'm busy. Scram.
You don't know #p1052000# like I do. What were you offered in return for helping #p1052000#? It doesn't matter, I can never forgive him. Please leave...
Maybe, maybe not! But I have responsibilities! I've served longer as chief of this town than you've been alive. Who are you to chastise ME?

You want to talk to me? I'm the chief of this town, and I have no time for a conversation. If you really want to talk to me, then collect these materials on behalf of the town. #b#e50#n #t4000007#s#k and #b#e100#n #b#t4000002#s#k. Then we'll talk.
